oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Erprobung und Bewertung eines neuen Geräts zur Unterstockpflege (SIEGWALD HS 1200) im ökologischen Weinbau
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pauly, J.
Mohr, D. H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Viticulture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new system for under-vine cultivation (SIEGWALD HS 1200) was tested over a period of two years in four farms with organic viticulture and compared with their customary systems. The SIEGWALD system has well proved its worth. The total costs were comparable to those of other systems. All tractors met the requirements of the SIEGWALD system. Vine trunks were not injured, except in one vineyard. Negative consequences for the fauna on the soil surface and for predatory mites (Typhlodromus pyri) in the canopy were not found.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Pauly, J. and Mohr, D. H. (2002) Erprobung und Bewertung eines neuen Geräts zur Unterstockpflege (SIEGWALD HS 1200) im ökologischen Weinbau. [Test and valuation of a new system for under-vine cultivation (SIEGWALD HS 1200) in organic viticulture.] In: Boos, Markus (Ed.) Ecofruit - 10th International Conference on Cultivation Technique and Phytopathological Problems in Organic Fruit-Growing and Viticulture. Proceedings to the Conference from 4th to 7th Feb. 2002 at Weinsberg/Germany, pp. 243-244.
